title: The Magic of Knowing When to Use Concrete vs. Abstract Language - By Jonah Berger - Behavioral Scientist
excerpt: When trying to make language either more concrete or more abstract, one helpful approach is to focus on either the how or the why.

title: Consumers Are Becoming Wise to Your Nudge - Behavioral Scientist
excerpt: New research indicates that consumers are catching on and may be annoyed by certain nudges, potentially limiting their effectiveness.

title: How to Make Your Product Scientifically Irresistible | Gainsight Software
excerpt: Your product can’t suck. That’s a given. But it’s also not enough to be a good product that doesn’t hook your customer and connect to their pain points.

title: Neuro-Menus and Restaurant Psychology
excerpt: Restaurants are great test labs for testing neuromarketing techniques. It's easy to change offerings, menus, and pricing, and one gets immediate feedback on what's working and what's not. Today, many eateries are employing sophisticated menu psychology to maximize sales and profits.

title: Leading Cross-Functional Teams
excerpt: This is the legendary presentation about cross-functional teams from Ken Norton that made donuts and product management synonymous.

title: The Engineering of the Chain Restaurant Menu
excerpt: At IHOP and Applebee's, menus are sales documents. And navigational guides. And explainers.

title: 15 Steps to Understand & Influence User Behavior: A Deep Dive
excerpt: Understanding user behavior is key to understanding how users interact with your product. Here are 15 steps to analyze & change their interactions to your benefit.
